A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It is rare that a sequel is able to simultaneously abandon the flavour\, style and soul of the predecessors\, whilst also ripping them off shamelessly. As such\, The Last Jedi is at least a rarity. Quite aside from the poor dialogue\, dull plot and clumsy attempts at humour\, it was certain individual scenes (and a few individual sub-plots) which really set this apart as the worst Star Wars film. Anyone who has watched the movie will understand these references: 'super-Leia'; 'space-horses'; 'the Phasma scene'. Oh and the shot for shot remake of the attack on Echo base\, except (and this twist was pointed out bluntly on-screen) the fight takes place on salt rather than snow. Fantastic.
